page.title: 01NORTH-EAST OF ANDOVER
page.content: To the north-east of{Andover,}between {Picket Piece}and the picturesque village of{St Mary Bourne,}lies an area of beautiful rolling downland. Mostly comprising fields used for {arable farming}and dotted with sizeable copses, it is crossed by two minor roads and the{main rail line}to London. Almost in the shadow of the imposing nineteenth century railway {viaduct}near St Mary Bourne lies the area's largest industry - the Vitacress{watercress beds;}other local businesses include a{scrap metal}firm, a{pub}and adjoining{restaurant}and, just outside Picket Piece, a{campsite. Other points of local interest include a game{shooting school,}a {disused railway}line and the tracks of the{Devil's Ditch}and Port Way{Roman {road.
